Detailed Description

Class describing the UDP's sent to the MapModule to get the closest item to the given coordinates.

After the general RequestPacket-header the format is (X = REQUEST_HEADER_SIZE):
PosSizeComment
X 4 bytes The latitud, in ``our'' coordinate system.
X+4 4 bytes The longitud, in ``our'' coordinate system.
X+8 4 bytes The data that should be included in the reply packet. Choose among the flags defined in the request packet. If zero is specified, all outdata are included.
X+12 2 byte The angle of the car.
X+14 2 byte RESERV
X+16 4 byte The wanted language.
X+20 1 byte The number of allowed item types in the reply. If zero all item types are allowed.
X+21 1 byte The first wanted item type.
X+22 1 byte The second wanted item type.
-

Definition at line 58 of file CoordinatePacket.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CoordinateRequestPacket::CoordinateRequestPacket (  uint16  packetID,
uint16  requestID,
int32  lat,
int32  lon,
uint32  originIP = 0,
uint16  originPort = 0,
uint16  angle = MAX_UINT16,
LangTypes::language_t  language = LangTypes::english
) 
 

Creates one Requestpacket with the given parameters.

This method is inlined.

Parameters:
packetID The id of the packet.
requestID The id of the request.
lat The latitude in the coordinate.
lon The longitude in the coordinate.
originIP The sender's IP (default = 0).
originPort The port to reply to (default = 0).
angle The angle of the car.
language The wanted language. (default = english)

void CoordinateRequestPacket::addItemType (  byte  type  )  [inline]
 

Adds one allowed item type to the packet.

If no itemtypes are added then all item types are allowed in the answer.

Parameters:
type The item type to add to this packet.
